pr_title: Make type parameter names in dataflow framework consistent.

timeline.bodyText: the transfer result to use maybe? The type is confusing, b/c we use the value from that transfer result.
timeline.author: wmdietl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -400,13 +400,17 @@ protected void propagateStoresTo(
     /**
      * Updates the value of node {@code node} to the value of the {@code transferResult}. Returns
      * true if the node's value changed, or a store was updated.
+     *
+     * @param node a node
+     * @param transferResult the result type of a transfer function

timeline.bodyText: Similarly, the type here doesn't seem necessary.
timeline.author: wmdietl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -416,8 +420,12 @@ protected boolean updateNodeValues(Node node, TransferResult<A, S> transferResul
 
     /**
      * Call the transfer function for node {@code node}, and set that node as current node first.
+     *
+     * @param node a node
+     * @param store the input type of a transfer function

timeline.bodyText: the {@code b} part is unnecessary, here and below.
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText: Links to the types are unnecessary in the description - javadoc already links the types in the signature.
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText:
ConditionalTransferResult below uses
 * @param <S> the {@link Store} used to keep track of intermediate results
Maybe also make all these descriptions consistent?
In this particular case, the two descriptions aren't symmetric, which makes them a bit ugly.
timeline.author: wmdietl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -21,12 +21,13 @@
  * providing the abstract values given a node or a tree. Note that it does not keep track of custom
  * results computed by some analysis.
  *
- * @param <A> type of the abstract value that is tracked
+ * @param <V> type of the abstract value that is tracked
+ * @param <S> the store type used in the analysis

timeline.bodyText: There already is some javadoc above. Can you merge the two?
timeline.author: wmdietl

@@ -37,8 +38,18 @@
      *     produced
      * @param exceptionalStores the stores to use if the basic block throws an exception
      */

timeline.bodyText:
Should the linked constructor be consistent with the @see constructor below? At the moment this links to itself, which doesn't make much sense.
The implementation actually calls a constructor without a map...
Should it be documented that false is used for the boolean?
Same comment for the constructor below this one.
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText: Same comment about self-referential constructor docs in this class.
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText: Can you add a summary for this constructor? At the top it currently has * *.
timeline.author: wmdietl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -32,28 +33,36 @@
      * class (including use through aliases). Complete control over the object is transfered to this
      * class.
      *

timeline.bodyText: Another link to the same constructor.
